author: Melos Han-Tani

text: I remember using my mom's super old laptop, using the dial-up internet (cause that was the only way to do it back then. lol) just to wait like 10 minutes to download this song from the internet. I can't remember the site but it had a bunch of video game midis and after the first time I heard this, I was enchanted for weeks. lol This song gives me such good memories of way back when.

text: I've created so many characters in this game that this theme has been etched into my brain.

text: Favorite character creation music.
author: Jenali

text: Always wanted to play this back in the day. Great song.
author: BaoZakeruga

text: @BaoZakeruga you can still play it, I could finally play it online last year from my Wii and my GC copy of the game, since I could never find the broadband adapter for GC, I found a way to play it with my Wi-Fi on the Schthack (private) Server, theres people playing from dreamcast, PC and GC the community is pretty well nice. On the other hand If you get bored by the look of the game, you can download for free PSO 2 launched only on pc for japan at the end of 2012, but there are plenty of good english patches and a full server for people from america and europe, :D
author: Kevin Mejia

text: This games soundtrack was almost better than the actual game. The game was fun though, SEGA should make a sequel for modern consoles, Id buy it in a heartbeat
author: MCHellshit

text: @MCHellshit There is a PSO2, but it's only been released in Japan thus far and the gameplay is more in line with something like Tera, but it's still a lot of fun. A group of English PSO fans are working on a translation for the game too.
author: Woodo

text: YES. PSO has one one of my favorite soundtracks of all time, even if the game gets old after about an hour of play. This is definitely one of the standout tracks, too.
